item.title: Two Ukrainians working for Russia behind rail sabotage, Polish PM says
item.description: Donald Tusk said the two suspects had entered Poland from Belarus and had long worked for Russia.

item.title: Venezuela's Maduro 'ready to talk' as US ramps up pressure
item.description: Following increased US pressure on the Venezuelan government, the two sides say they are open to talks.

item.title: US to sell F-35 jets to Saudi Arabia, Trump says ahead of crown prince's visit
item.description: Trump will welcome Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to the White House for the first time since Jamal Khashoggi's murder.

item.title: At least 94 Palestinians died in Israeli prisons in two years, human rights group says
item.description: A new report by Physicians for Human Rights Israel (PHRI) alleges "systematic killings and cover-ups".

item.title: Brazil creates new Indigenous territories during protest-hit COP30
item.description: President Lula's government recognises 10 new Indigenous lands in an effort to protect their culture and environment.
